other_tests.findings: The liver is diffusely echogenic, consistent with fatty infiltration. Adjacent to the gallbladder fundus is a small area of focal fatty sparing. The gallbladder is normal without evidence of stones. The common duct is not dilated. The portal vein is patent with appropriate hepatopetal flow. Limited views of the kidneys are normal. The pancreatic tail is not well seen due to overlying bowel gas. However, visualized portions of the pancreas are unremarkable. The spleen is unremarkable. The aorta is of normal caliber throughout.
